In this stained glass panel  (c.1485) from the south clerestory (window M) of Great Malvern Priory, Worcs., Moses stands in a landscape with his left hand raised and a rod in his right. He is bearded and from his hat golden rays spring. Behind him stands another bearded man. The falling manna (represented by 26 white disks) is seen in the sky and on the ground, where it is gathered into baskets by two kneeling men. Behind, a third gatherer, now fragmentary. Above this group, on the right, a man in a jewelled turban stands catching the falling manna in his mantle. Above him stands another man looking upwards with raised and extended hands. The composition of this panel is almost identical with depictions of this subject in the 'Biblia Pauperum' and is evidently derived from it.
